cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with index coding, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). It specifically focuses on scalar linear index codes, which are a type of coding scheme used in network coding (cs.NI). The paper also discusses a lifting construction, which is a technique used in graph theory and optimization (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper mentions several instances of canonical multiple unicast index coding problems, which are related to distributed storage (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses optimal scalar linear index codes, which are a type of coding scheme used in communication complexity (cs.CC).
